info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Broadwater and south central Meagher Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 453 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Townsend, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Broadwater and south central Meagher Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways, or even minor localized flooding of low lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
